answers.author: Derek Johnson
answers.text:
Scott,  
Cost of maintenance per square foot would depend on many factors (size and age of the specific building, what type of facilities it had, the number of inmates, etc).  Incarceration costs are normally broken down by cost per inmate per year or day. The Bureau of Justice Statistics provides such information. You can click on the link below to find out more: 
http://bjs.ojp.usdoj.gov/index.cfm?ty=tp&tid=16 
For jail CONSTRUCTION costs, Reed Construction Data, a subsidiary of Reed Business Information, provides free estimates of cost per square foot depending on size and region of the jail in question.  
http://www.reedconstructiondata.com/rsmeans/models/jail/ 
You can find out the cost of jail construction per square foot for cities near Sonoma, such as Vallejo, Santa Rosa and Berkeley by visiting this page: 
http://www.reedconstructiondata.com/rsmeans/models/jail/list/ 
PLEASE BE AWARE: ICMA does not endorse the purchase of RS Means products or the MeansCostWorks software advertised on the pages linked. These are simply links to free professional estimates that can hopefully point you in the right direction.   
Hope this data helps! 
Derek Johnson

author: Scott Murphy
text:
We are working on our dashboards. I would like to know the average cost per SqFt to maintain a jail. I think the average cost for a "normal" building is about $1.70 per SqFt but would like to compare it to our detention centers.
Thank you, Scott Murphy
County of Sonoma, General Services Administration
